the maximum strike for which the term structure can return vols

memberdef.name: checkRange

detaileddescription.para: Implements the actual volatility surface calculation in derived classes e.g. bilinear interpolation. N.B. does not derive the surface.

description.para: calculate the reference date based on the global evaluation date

memberdef.name: volatility

detaileddescription.para: Returns the volatility for a given maturity date and strike rate that observes inflation, by default, with the observation lag of the term structure. Because inflation is highly linked to dates (for interpolation, periods, etc) we do NOT provide a time version.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Period &optionTenor, Rate strike, const Period &obsLag=Period(-1, Days), bool extrapolate=false) const
memberdef.name: volatility

briefdescription.para: returns the volatility for a given option tenor and strike rate

detaileddescription.para: Returns the volatility for a given time and strike rate. No adjustments due to lags and interpolation are applied to the input time.

briefdescription.para: Returns the displacement for lognormal volatilities.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Date &exerciseDate, Rate strike, const Period &obsLag=Period(-1, Days), bool extrapolate=false) const
memberdef.name: totalVariance

briefdescription.para: Returns the total integrated variance for a given exercise date and strike rate.

detaileddescription.para: Total integrated variance is useful because it scales out t for the optionlet pricing formulae. Note that it is called "total" because the surface does not know whether it represents Black, Bachelier or Displaced Diffusion variance. These are virtual so alternate connections between const vol and total var are possible.
Because inflation is highly linked to dates (for interpolation, periods, etc) we do NOT provide a time version

memberdef.argsstring: (const Period &optionTenor, Rate strike, const Period &obsLag=Period(-1, Days), bool extrapolate=false) const
memberdef.name: totalVariance

briefdescription.para: returns the total integrated variance for a given option tenor and strike rate

detaileddescription.para: The TS observes with a lag that is usually different from the availability lag of the index. An inflation rate is given, by default, for the maturity requested assuming this lag.

briefdescription.para: base date will be in the past because of observation lag

detaileddescription.para: Abstract interface ... no data, only results.
Basically used to change the BlackVariance() methods to totalVariance. Also deal with lagged observations of an index with a (usually different) availability lag.
